issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: expand HIVE-20400 (always using absolute paths) to all locations in Hive (create/alter table, partition, database, etc.)

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: create table should always use a fully qualified path to avoid potential FS ambiguity

I agree with the point that paths provided in DDL create statements should be absolute.  But how does this change current behavior?  It seems like it should at least print out a warning message that it is making the path absolute.  And does this fix the issue for databases and partitions too, or will a separate fix be needed for those?

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12935792/HIVE-20400.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12935942 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
+1.  It would be good to file a separate issue that notes that this could be a problem for databases and partitions as well.
Committed to master. Thanks for the review; I filed HIVE-20414 to follow up
